Player History
Drafted in 5th round, 98th overall pick, by Longport in 1964...
Traded from Longport to Gashouse on 4/26/1967 (Going to GHG: RF B. Koonce. Going to LP: P S. Machado)...
Injured on 5/22/1967 with a Pinched Nerve Neck, out for 6 days...
Injured on 7/29/1968 with a Strained Hip Muscle, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 6/22/1971, off Barry Ross (Ash)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/12/1972, off Angelo Bustos (LYN)...
Injured on 5/14/1972 with a Pulled Anterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 3 weeks...
Won World Championship with Gashouse in 1973...
Had 5 hits with 9 RBI against Troy on 5/14/1974...
Won World Championship with Gashouse in 1976...
Signed as a free agent by New Jersey on 3/1/1983 to a minor league contract.
Released by New Jersey on 8/4/1984...
